00017 package WeBWorK::PG::Remote;
00018 use base qw(WeBWorK::PG);
00019 
00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::PG::Remote - Use the WeBWorK::PG API to invoke a remote problem
00023 renderer via SOAP.
00024 
00025 =cut
00026 
00027 use strict;
00028 use warnings;
00029 use SOAP::Lite;
00030 use WeBWorK::Utils qw(readFile);
00031 
00032 sub new {
00033     my $invocant = shift;
00034     my $class = ref($invocant) || $invocant;
00035     my (
00036         $ce,
00037         $user,
00038         $key,
00039         $set,
00040         $problem,
00041         $psvn, #FIXME -- not used
00042         $formFields, # in CGI::Vars format
00043         $translationOptions, # hashref containing options for the
00044                              # translator, such as whether to show
00045                              # hints and the display mode to use
00046     ) = @_;
00047     
00048     ##### READ SOURCE FILE #####
00049     
00050     my $sourceFile = $problem->source_file;
00051     $sourceFile = $ce->{courseDirs}->{templates}."/".$sourceFile
00052         unless ($sourceFile =~ /^\//);
00053     my $source = eval { readFile($sourceFile) };
00054     if ($@) {
00055         # well, we couldn't get the problem source, for some reason.
00056         return bless {
00057             translator => undef,
00058             head_text  => "",
00059             body_text  => <<EOF,
00060 WeBWorK::Utils::readFile($sourceFile) says:
00061 $@
00062 EOF
00063             answers    => {},
00064             result     => {},
00065             state      => {},
00066             errors     => "Failed to read the problem source file.",
00067             warnings   => "",
00068             flags      => {error_flag => 1},
00069         }, $class;
00070     }
00071     
00072     ##### DEFINE REQUEST #####
00073     
00074     my $envir = $class->defineProblemEnvir(
00075         $ce,
00076         $user,
00077         $key,
00078         $set,
00079         $problem,
00080         $psvn, #FIXME -- not used
00081         $formFields,
00082         $translationOptions,
00083     );
00084     
00085     my (@modules_to_load, @extra_packages_to_load);
00086     my @modules = @{ $ce->{pg}->{modules} };
00087     foreach my $module_packages_ref (@modules) {
00088         my ($module, @extra_packages) = @$module_packages_ref;
00089         # the first item is the main package
00090         push @modules_to_load, $module;
00091         # the remaining items are "extra" packages
00092         push @extra_packages_to_load, @extra_packages;
00093     }
00094     
00095     my $request = {
00096         course                 => $ce->{courseName},
00097         source                 => $source,
00098         modules_to_evaluate    => [ @modules_to_load ],
00099         extra_packages_to_load => [ @extra_packages_to_load ],
00100         envir                  => $envir,
00101         problem_state          => {
00102             recorded_score       => $problem->status,
00103             sub_recorded_score =>   $problem->sub_status,
00104             num_of_correct_ans   => $problem->num_correct,
00105             num_of_incorrect_ans => $problem->num_incorrect,
00106         },
00107         options                => $translationOptions,
00108     };
00109     
00110     ##### CALL REMOTE RENDERER #####
00111     
00112     my $package = __PACKAGE__;
00113     my $proxy = $ce->{pg}->{renderers}->{$package}->{proxy};
00114     
00115     my $soap = SOAP::Lite
00116         ->uri("urn:RenderD")
00117         ->proxy($proxy);
00118     my $query = $soap->render($request);
00119     
00120     ##### HANDLE ERRORS #####
00121     
00122     if ($query->fault) {
00123         return bless {
00124             translator => undef,
00125             head_text  => "",
00126             body_text  => $query->faultstring,
00127             answers    => {},
00128             result     => {},
00129             state      => {},
00130             errors     => "Failed to call the remote renderer."
00131                 . " (error " . $query->faultcode . ")",
00132             warnings   => "",
00133             flags      => {error_flag => 1},
00134         }, $class;
00135     }
00136     
00137     ##### RETURN RESULTS #####
00138     
00139     return $query->result;
00140 }
00141 
00142 1;
00143 
00144 __END__
00145 
00146 =head1 OPERATION
00147 
00148 WeBWorK::PG::Remote goes through the following operations when constructed:
00149 
00150 =over
00151 
00152 =item Read the problem source file
00153 
00154 Reads the contents of the problem source file from disk.
00155 
00156 =item Compile a problem environment
00157 
00158 Use data from the user, set, and problem, as well as the course
00159 environemnt and translation options, to compile a problem environment.
00160 The default subroutine, &WeBWorK::PG::defineProblemEnvir, is used.
00161 
00162 =item Compile a list of modules to load
00163 
00164 Use the course environment to compile a list of modules to load and
00165 extra packages to import.
00166 
00167 =item Call the remote renderer
00168 
00169 Use SOAP::Lite to call the C<renderd> remote rendering daemon.
00170 
00171 =back
00172 
00173 =head1 AUTHOR
00174 
00175 Written by Sam Hathaway, sh002i (at) math.rochester.edu.
00176 
00177 =cut
